title: Using variable to reference class object
body:
This has probably already been answered somewhere but I cannot come up with the right search words to find it. I have a class of objects:

public class myclass {
    object myobject1;
    object myobject2;
}

I want to reference a particular element symbolically but I don't know the proper syntax. By that I mean I want to do something like the following:

myclass objectclass=new myclass();
String name="myobject1";
object objectclass.name="some value";

How can a use variables to reference class elements? TIA.
